c_title: 6 Ways Running Can Rejuvenate Your Mind
c_mobile_body:
It has been widely seen that meditation is considered as the best key to a peaceful mind. Undoubtedly, it helps in refreshing your mind and soul. It is also beneficial in combating mental disorders like depression, hypertension, anxiety and many more.


However, you need to believe that meditation is not the only key to a healthy mind. Everyone knows that running has enormous benefits on our body. But it is also one of the most effective keys to your mental well being. It works amazingly on relieving stress, depression, boosting memory and brain power.


It is an activity which cleans and clears out the negative blockage persisting in your mind. It is a tried and tested formula by avid runners that a good run can make you feel like a brand new person in a single go.Adding running to your fitness routine can make a modest difference in your mind.


Irrespective of your age, running can actually make you feel rejuvenated from inside. Those who run regularly feel more energetic throughout the day, get better sleep at night and feel more positive about their lives.  It is known to be a really powerful remedy for many challenging mental disorders.


Let’s have a look at the below benefits of running which can make you feel refreshed:


1. Running averts comparisons



Unlike other team based sports, running is an individual activity. It involves individual effort and pursuit. When you take up running to lose weight or become fit, you set a benchmark and you keep comparing your present performance with your own previous condition. In other words, in running you compare yourself to you. Running makes you your only opponent. Hence, this particular exercise is good for gaining self- confidence.

Continuity in self comparisons makes you more confident about yourself. When you beat your own target in running, you gain more self- esteem. It also helps in making you self- motivated and determined. Self determination is another way of accomplishing better in life.

Running gives you self- esteem and confidence. These two are the most important aspects in one’s professional journey. When you reach at a stage where all you have is self- esteem and confidence, you always look for possibilities rather than problems. Running flushes out negative thoughts from your mind. It makes you feel good about yourself. You progress each day by setting new goals in running.


2. Running boosts memory



If you have a doubt that later in life you might go through Dementia or Alzheimer’s disease then running is made for you. It is a great brain activity. It enlarges that portion of your brain which controls hearing, memory, vision and learning. As it very well increases the metabolic functions of overall body, it successfully shows the boosted result in your brain first.


Running makes your brain stronger and sharper. When it increases metabolism of your brain, it starts functioning properly and boosts memory. Running teaches your brain to embrace new, positive and self motivating thoughts.Running is the best way to amplify the cognitive functions of your brain.


Cognitive functions such as thinking, reasoning and differentiating are handled by different lobes of the brain.  It also helps in improving the ability of different body parts and brain to communicate better. Hence, it helps in maintaining good coordination between brain and body.


Researchers also believe that running helps the brain in storing higher amounts of glycogen. These large stores of glycogen in brain tend to improve cognitive function.


It helps different body parts and brain to coordinate and work better. It is beneficial in boosting overall health of your brain.


3. Running cuts off stress


 

Stress comes with a lot of reasons. These reasons may mainly be the inappropriate work schedule or lifestyle. You may notice many symptoms of stress like severe pain in neck, back, shoulder and head. When you are under stress, you also go through insomnia, diarrhoea, stomach ache and many other problems.


All these symptoms can easily turn into harmful effects of stress when not treated with any outdoor physical activity. This can also lead to negative coordination between mind, body and soul.


The best way to overcome stress is running. It is one of the most effective activities to break the symptoms of stress. Since, running helps in making your body physically fit, it works well on body pain. It also helps the mind to combat the problem of insomnia and depression. Running is a great activity for brain which helps in relaxing brain muscles.


It regulates your sleep pattern and promotes deeper sleep for relieving stress. When you start running regularly, your body and mind become fit and coordinate well with each other.


Your mind and body are closely linked with each other. Therefore, they need an exercise which can work on both simultaneously. Running makes your body feel better which leads to a healthier and happier mind.


4. Running provides mental energy


 

Running is a form of relaxation in its own way. In this fast moving life, you utilize your mind 24 x 7 for performing day to day functions better. But you never think of providing energy to your mind which commands your body to act. People in today’s time, don’t leave their mind free from thinking even for a minute.


This leads to over thinking which in turn exhausts their mind badly. There is no big deal that frequent exertion of brain may lead to serious damage and memory shortage in the later years of life.


Running clears your mind from over thinking and negative thoughts. When you start running, the physical exertion in body takes away the mind from mental pressure. You start focusing more on pushing your body to accomplish your running goals.


Running is a great form of meditation as it frees your mind from your surroundings.


Running contributes well in making your mind calm and relaxed. Since, running is a physical activity, it allows you to invest energy in your body letting your mind to relax for a while.


When you give your mind some time to relax, it regains energy to perform activities better all day long. 


5. Running controls ageing of brain



This is an amazing benefit of running for those who have added running in their daily routine. Regular running keeps your brain sharp and agile. There are various studies worldwide which show running on regular basis helps in the formation of new nerve cells in your brain.


It stimulates the number of blood vessels in your brain which increases the blood flow effectively. This particular function helps in keeping your brain focused every day long.


It is a scientific fact that brain is one body part that tends to shrink in size as per your age. In such cases, a good regular run acts as a brain booster. There are several studies available on internet that say running helps in increasing the volume of your midbrain which is responsible for integrating bodily controls over vision, hearing and memory.


Moreover, running not only reduces the shrinkage process of the brain in later age but also initiates flow of some important brain chemicals. These chemicals are very much important for the healthy life of your brain. 


Running is an extremely effective exercise for brain. It not only improves the metabolism of your body but also boosts metabolism of your brain.


Keeping the brain active, sharp and focused are the most important benefits which can be enjoyed only by a regular runner throughout his life.


6. Running beats anxiety


 

Running is an anti- anxiety therapy. It relieves stress and boosts mental energy. Anxiety keeps developing in mind with the growth of tough decision makings in life. Constant worries and tension also make you the victim of anxiety or panic attacks.


When you start running, your brain begins building new neurons. These are very important in managing the activities of your brain.


It is believed that new and fresh cells in the brain manage your emotions very well. When emotions are managed well, mind is clear and mood is fresh, you beat anxiety unbelievably.

  

To rejuvenate mind better, you can also take up healthy diet with your regular running routine. Fresh and organic food helps in keeping your mood elevated all day long.


Healthy diet will also help you reduce unwanted fat from your body. This also leads to proper functioning of brain, keeping it active all day long.


“One run can change your day; many runs can change your life.”

c_title: 24 Simple Tips to Lose Belly Fat Naturally At Home
c_mobile_body:
The excessive fat around the stomach area also known as the “belly fat” is a result of sedentary lifestyle and poor eating habits. Apart from giving you an odd looking body shape this belly fat can have serious health effects too.


It can lead to heart diseases, dementia, diabetes and many more. Most of the people have a notion that ‘eating less’ and ‘starving’ is a way to get rid of this fat, but it turns out to be a bad idea and might result in dangerous side-effects.


Also Read: Natural Ways to Burn Fat And Build Muscle


Rather, the cure to belly fat is to eat the right set of foods which can boost your metabolism. Luckily, there are so many spices and foods easily available at your home that you can use to get rid of this fat naturally. Here’s everything that you need to know about the cure of belly fat naturally at home.


Causes of Belly Fat


  • Intake of carbohydrates in excessive amount
  • All the Junk Food
  • Heavy Dinner
  • Less physical activities
  • Genetics



Remedies to lose belly fat naturally at home



1)  Lemon water Drink (Early Morning)



This is one of the best remedies to cure belly fat. Follow this as your morning routine on an empty stomach. All you need to do is – squeeze half a lemon in warm water and then add a pinch of salt to it. Lemon increases your metabolism rate and hence aids in losing belly fat.


You can add honey if you want. Do this on a regular basis and you will surely notice the difference.



2)  Avoid White Rice



It’s better to replace white rice with brown rice and other wheat based products. White rice is packed with carbohydrates. Rather replace them with brown bread, oats, wholegrains and quinoa.


Also Read: Best Running Tips to Boost Weight Loss


3)  Drink lots of water



Drinking plenty of water has so many health benefits. It removes the toxins from your body and at the same time increases your metabolism rate.


This will thoroughly cleanse your body and let you get rid of belly fat easily.

  


4)  Reduce Sugar Intake


 

Eating sugars in large amount is the worst thing that you can do to your body. Sugars are a package full of carbohydrates and hence thwart your ‘weight loss journey’. Sugars increase the fat near your belly region.


So you really need to stay away from sweet drinks and other sugar rich foods. If you feel the urge to intake sugar then you can have it once in a while but in low amounts.



5)  Garlic (Raw form)



Consume three to four cloves of raw garlic, followed by the morning lemon-water drink. Accompanying garlic with lemon water will quadruple your weight loss procedure.


Apart from aiding in weight loss, garlic is also said to improve blood circulation in your body. Read: Benefits of Eating Raw Garlic on Empty Stomach



6)  Green Tea



In a study conducted by – “American Journal of Clinical Nutrition”, it was observed that people who had four cups of green tea regularly lost approximately six pounds in eight weeks. Green tea contains epigallocatechin-3-gallate also known as “EGCG”.


EGCG helps in boosting body metabolism and is antioxidants rich. So, sipping three to four cups of green tea on daily basis can be a great way to eliminate belly fat.



7)  Chia Seeds


 

Chia seeds are a great source of omega 3 acids, calcium, antioxidants, iron and dietary fibres. Having chia seeds makes you feel full for longer. It is recommended that you take three to four tablespoon of chia seeds during the day time.


Just add them to your salads or your yogurt. Incorporating chia seeds to your daily diet will surely help in losing belly fat.



8)  Cayenne Pepper


 

Crush cayenne pepper and ginger together. Consume this mixture every day. Along with flushing out fat from your body, it will also aid in cleansing out the lungs.



9)  Ginger Tea


Ginger is a thermogenic agent. Thermogenic agent substances increase your body temperature and as a result burn your body fat more effectively.


Ginger also has natural digestive aiding properties. So having ginger tea is a great solution to your belly fat reduction.



10)  Oats Breakfast



Oats are rich in dietary fibres and very low on calories. They make you feel full for longer. So having oats in your breakfast is a way to keep check on your calorie intake and getting all the dietary fibres to flush out fats.


Also Read: 9 most effective exercises for women to tone lower body﻿


11)  Apples



“An apple a day keeps the doctor away.” Fortunately, it keeps the fat away too. It also helps in fighting diseases and great when it comes to belly fat elimination.


It also makes your stomach feel full as it is potassium and vitamin rich.



12)  Fish Oil



Fish oil is rich in omega-3 acids. Linolenic acid – a form of omega-3 acid helps in reducing fat around the belly region. Linolenic acid is present in good amount in fish oil and thus aid in losing belly fat.


It is recommended to take around 6 grams (approximately 1 tablespoon) of fish oil on daily basis.



13)  Snack on Almonds



Almonds are packed with Vitamin E and thus it makes you fell full for a long time, thereby you eat less.



14)  Mint Leaves



Mint is a great metabolism booster. A good way to intake mint is by making a drink of crushed mint leaves. Take 1 tablespoon of honey, crushed mint leaves and ¼ tablespoon of pepper.


Add all of these to 1 cup of warm water and let it stay for 5 minutes. Then strain the drink and enjoy.



15)  Cranberry Juice



Cranberries are a great source of citric and malic acid. These acids play a role of digestive enzymes. All the waste in your body that your liver is unable to process is sent to the lymphatic system.


Cranberries are good at digesting these lymphatic wastes and thus helping you reduce fat.



16)  Flat Belly Drink

 

Just take ginger, crushed mint leaves, lemon and cucumber. Combine all these ingredients and let them soak in water overnight. Drink it throughout the next day. All these ingredients combined together make an excellent fat burner drink.


Cucumber is rich in dietary fibres and water. It detoxifies your body and aids in weight loss. Lemon, mint and ginger also play as catalysts. This drink is so effective that people also refer this to as the “Flat Belly Drink”.



17)  Cardamom



Cardamom has the ability to reduce water retention and also boosts digestion and metabolism. It is also a great detoxifying agent.



18)  Watermelons



Watermelons consist of 81% water. They make your stomach feel full, in a way avoiding overeating. Apart from the fat burning properties, watermelons are also a great source of Vitamin C.



19)  Add spices to your food



Spices like black pepper, cayenne pepper, and cinnamon are full of health benefits. These spices work in a way that they increase your body temperature and thus fasten up the fat oxidation process.


Another good reason to load up your food with spices is that it reduces your blood sugar levels as well.



20)  Peanut Butter



An ingredient called ‘Niacin’ is present in peanut butter. Niacin keeps a check on your tummy and avoids it from bloating. It also boosts your body metabolism and puts a lid on your appetite.



21)  Bananas



Bananas are great at meting belly fat fast. They are rich sources of vitamins and potassium. They resist your cravings by making you feel full for longer.



22)  Eat green Veggies and fruits


Fruits and green veggies are loaded with antioxidants, vitamins and minerals. So eating fresh fruits and veggies will surely aid in your weight loss process.



23)  Egg white



Egg whites are rich in omega-3 acids, iron, zinc and phosphorous. All of these ingredients hold great fat burning properties.



24)  Avocado


 

Avocados are fibre rich fruits and have monounsaturated fatty acids. Eating monounsaturated fatty acids instead of saturated fats is a lot healthier option. Having avocados is a great way to feel full and help in burning fats.


Of course, all of these aforementioned home remedies play a vital role in eliminating belly fat but accompanying them with good eating habits and a healthy lifestyle including physical activities can do wonders.


These are the small lifestyle hacks that you might want to incorporate as a daily habit and stay healthy always:



* Get enough sleep


 

The prominent reason for the fat accumulation near your belly area is lack of sleep. Lack of sleep makes you crave for oily foods and sugar. So sleeping well is a must habit apart from anything else.



* Choose your snack munchies wisely


Although it is okay to have junk food sometimes, but make sure to keep a check on the quantity of your junk food consumption. Munching on fruits and low calorie healthy snacks can contribute in a great way to a good lifestyle.



* Consume more of Vitamin C

 

Lemons and oranges are a great source.



* Reduce your alcohol intake


 

Alcoholic drinks are loaded with calories and what makes matters worse is that even after consuming a lot of calories you still don’t feel full.



* Don’t skip meals

 

When you deliberately starve to hunger the body reacts in away by storing the food as fats.

So skipping meals in order to lose weight is not a good option at all.



* Include exercise in your routine


 

You tend to burn more calories when you indulge in physical activities like cycling, exercising, working out, aerobics and a lot more.


Happy Living!

c_title: How To Be Slim And Fit
c_mobile_body:
Well, you don’t need to follow any trendy diets or starve to hunger in order to be slim and fit. It turns out that a well-balanced diet and adopting better lifestyle habits are the most effective way to become healthy and maintain an optimal weight.  


Just by following these simple guidelines you will be surprised to see how quickly you can tone up your body and become slim and fit. So let’s dive deep in and explore all the possible ways out.



Better eating habits


 

Heavy Breakfast


 

First and the foremost advice of all times is to begin your day with a healthy high protein breakfast. Not only it makes you feel satiated and energised throughout the day but also keeps your body metabolism up and running.


 

Don’t Starve

 

You don’t need to deprive yourself of food but rather make healthy substitutes in your diet. For instance, choose yogurt rather than cream, honey syrup in place of sugar and replacing post meal sweets with berries or fruits.


Try substituting refined carbohydrates like white breads, pasta with complex carbohydrates like oatmeal and brown bread.


 

Eat Mindfully

 

Enjoy your food slowly than devouring it. Eat until your stomach is 80% full. This practice is very helpful in avoiding over-eating and helps in better digestion of food.


Apart from the health benefits, mindful eating will help your taste buds to sense your food to the fullest.


 

A light dinner


 

Avoid eating late at night. At least have a gap of about 2-3 hours between your last meal and sleep time.


Because of less body movement, the digestion process tends to slow down and as a result all the undigested food starts getting accumulated as fats.


Keeping a check on calories


 

Rather than consuming coffee or snacks in-between your meals, replace that with fruits and detox drinks like green tea.


It will be really helpful to cut down your daily calories.


Drink water before eating

 

Quite often we confuse our thirst with hunger and thus end up eating a snack when in reality the body is demanding water.


The reason is hypothalamus, it is the area in the brain that controls hunger and thirst and it sends the same signals for both. So when you are hungry first drink a glass of water and then eat. Chances are that your hunger will subdue.



Adopting better lifestyle habits




Drink Water


 

Drink plenty of water throughout the day. It helps to flush out toxins from your body. Studies have shown that taking 2-3 glasses of lukewarm water immediately after waking up on an empty stomach helps to boost your body metabolism and remove toxins from your body more effectively.


It is recommended to take a full glass of water just before your meal so as to decrease the overall hunger. Also: taking a glass of water after 30 minutes of having your meal aids in digestion. On an average drinking 8 to 10 glasses of water in a day are considered optimal.





Exercise


 

Nothing can replace the benefits of exercising. Simply running not only helps you in burning calories but it also keeps your body in good shape and reduces stress. In general running or jogging for 30 minutes twice or thrice a week is good enough to keep your body slim and fit.


Apart from running, including a few strength training exercises in your routine can prove to be extremely healthy for your body.


For instance, Push-ups and squats have proven to be one of the most effective exercises to burn calories. Exercising regularly will keep your body fit and in good shape throughout your lifetime.


 

Get enough sleep


 

Getting a sound and regular sleep plays an important role in maintaining healthy weight. The only time when your body rests, recovers and repairs itself is while you are sleeping. Studies have shown that people who do not sleep for adequate hours tend to be obese and unfit.


Also, same studies have confirmed that when you do not get adequate sleep then the level of ‘Ghrelin’ in your body rises. Ghrelin is the hunger hormone that your brain releases which asks you to eat more and as a result leading to obesity. A person should sleep atleast 8 hours in a day.



Walking


 

It is indeed the lack of physical activities which is one of the most prominent reasons of weight gain and unfit body. People can make excuse of their busy lifestyle in order to neglect regular exercise.


But when it comes to walking, it can be done anywhere and fits into daily routine easily. Simple yet effective ways to increase your physical activities can be like taking stairs instead of elevator and walking down to the nearby markets rather than taking your car.


Studies have shown that even taking a 10 minute walk post your meal can help you burn quick calories and aids digestion.

c_title: How to Reduce Tummy Fast By Home Remedies
c_mobile_body:
People are often asking these days on how to reduce tummy fast by home remedies? This is because obesity has become epidemic affecting millions of people around the world. The problem has been mainly attributed to the lifestyle changes especially with sedentary life of working class, consumption of junk food and lack of physical activity.


Genetic factors and hormonal problems are also responsible for overweight people. However, being overweight or fat isn’t necessarily bad from health viewpoint. It’s the fat in the abdominal cavity, the belly fat, that is much worrisome.


Not only does belly fat make you look unattractive, but also increases risk of various health issues like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart and liver disease.


If you have a lot of excess fat around your waistline, you should take appropriate action to get rid of it.


Home remedies can do wonder to the body if given a chance. Of course, it would require patience as to feel the difference, but it is totally worth it. Some of the easiest tips on how to reduce tummy fast by home remedies are:


1.Start your day with glass of water





If you want to get rid of excessive body fat and get a flat tummy, start your day with a warm glass of water. Nothing is healthier than drinking plain water as it helps your body get rid of toxins and aids in weight loss efforts. Add a splash of lemon or use various herbs from your kitchen to make a bland glass of water more exciting:


Lemon and Honey




Lemon water has been cited for its slimming down properties. Drinking lemon water is effective in detoxifying your liver and allows it to work more effectively to metabolize fats and thus get rid of excessive flab on your tummy.


  • Pinch some lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of honey into a glass of warm water.
  • Continue drinking this every morning.
  • Avoid eating at least for thirty minutes.


Ginger & Honey


Another solution for reducing your tummy fast is to include ginger in your water. Ginger is a natural digestive, removes toxins from your body, and suppresses your appetite.


  • Boil a glass of water and add a tsp of ginger paste
  • Then add 1 tbsp of honey and pepper.
  • Drink warm ginger and honey water twice a day for better results.


Apple Cider Vinegar




Apple cider vinegar with its acidic and corrosive properties helps you dispose of stomach fat. Additionally it keeps your digestive system working to its full potential even when resting or sleeping.


  • Add a spoonful of apple cider vinegar to a glass of water and drink every morning.


Mint Infused Water


Mint not only calms down your cravings but also soothes tummy after you indulge in foods.


  • Add 1 tablespoon honey, a pinch of pepper, and some crushed mint leaves to a cup of hot water.


Cinnamon Powder




Cinnamon is a thermogenic that helps reduce the overall body fat reducing your tummy fast.


  • Take ½ tablespoon of cinnamon powder and steep it in water for 5 minutes. A
  • Add 1 tablespoon of honey after straining the cinnamon water.
  • Drink this before breakfast and before going to bed.


Garlic




Garlic is known for its excellent anti-obesity properties as it hinders fat accumulation in the body. It is also a powerful detoxifier and effective diuretic. This contributes to production and release of urine from body which aids in increasing metabolism in the body. This treatment will double up your weight loss process and make your blood circulation smooth in your body.


  • Chew two to three cloves of garlic every morning
  • Follow it up with a glass of lemon water.


Also drink plenty of water, whole day long. Drinking six to eight glasses of water each day aids your digestion, reduces bloating, and keeps your metabolism functioning at its best.



2. Have a Healthy Breakfast




You ought not to skip breakfast. It is most important meal of the day and having a protein rich diet is necessary so that you don’t go having unhealthy snacks in between. Ensure you breakfast does not include sugar rich foods such as cereals, wafers, pancakes, muffins, sweetened juices etc. A healthy breakfast should compromise of:


Eggs




Have eggs in breakfast preferably hard boiled. Eggs are known for their satiety which means they will leave you feeling full much longer than cereal or toast. The protein and fat in eggs helps sustain your energy levels, keeping you satisfied for longer and reducing the need for a mid morning snack.


Yogurt




Yoghurt is another great option for breakfast. The probiotics in yogurt do wonders for the digestive tract and aids in breakdown of certain substances like fat. Add honey or fruits in yogurt for added flavors.


Whole Grain Cereals




Replace sweetened cereals with whole grain variety for breakfast. Have whole grain cereals with milk to reduce your tummy fast. High fibre breakfast cereals like oats will keep you satisfied longer for more periods helping evade cravings.


Peanut Butter




Peanut butter suppresses your appetite and boosts the metabolism. Peanut butter is rich in niacin that avoids your tummy from bloating. But avoid processed peanut butter and instead opt for homemade with less sugar.



3. Load your diet with these fruits and veggies




Eat a bowl of fruits daily in the morning and evening. This will fill you up with many antioxidants, minerals and vitamins.


Apple




You may well be aware of the saying, “Apple a day keeps the doctor away”. Besides keeping you healthy, eating Apple regularly helps reduce belly fat. They are packed with fibre which helps curb appetite, giving you a sense of fulfillment to body to help you avoid intaking any extra foods.


Avocado




Avocado is another great fruit for keeping your tummy flat. Rich in fiber, it keeps the hunger at bay. Moreover, the monounsaturated fatty acids in avocado help to reduce the belly fat.


Bananas


Replace your midday snacks with a banana. Similar to apples, bananas are also rich in potassium and contain multivitamins. They are quite filling and help you to resist the cravings for high salt/sugar foods. Bananas also boost the metabolic rate, thereby melting the belly fat.


Berries


Strawberries, blackberries and raspberries contain plenty of fibers and are loaded with vitamins, which help to fight the cravings for food and sugary substances. This will slim down your belly.


Celery


Drink celery juice or eat raw celery as a salad. Celery too helps to cut down the belly fat.


Cucumber




Eat a plate of cucumber salad daily to cleanse your body of harmful toxins and lose body weight. Cucumbers are packed with vitamins, minerals and dietary fibres.


Hot peppers


Hot peppers contain capsaicin which has thermogenic effects. It boosts your body’s heat production and thus uses more energy or calorie.


Dark Leafy Greens


Full of fiber, iron, and zinc – dark leafy greens like spinach, kale, and collard greens can help to turn your body into a fat-burning machine.


Papaya




Have a bowl full of ripe papaya as a mid-evening snack. Papaya is wonderful low calorie snack and keeps you stomach full. Loaded with antioxidants, vitamin C and dietary fiber it regulates stress hormones and prevents unhealthy eating.


Watermelon




Watermelon is a perfect fruit to keep your tummy flat. It contains 91% water, which keeps you feeling full longer and helps combat water retention.



4. Drink Juices to Lose Belly Fat




Juices may not necessarily help with the fat burning process itself, but they indirectly aid in reducing your tummy fast. Replace soft drinks or other processed sugary beverages with 100% natural, no-sugar-added juices.


Aloe-vera Juice




Aloe vera is a miracle herb with numerous health benefits. It aids to reduce your tummy fast by decreasing your muscle to fat ratio. Aloe vera also detoxifies your body and purifies digestive tract to further decrease weight.


  • Blend aloe vera juice and herb powders such as Turmeric, Cumin seeds, Tinospora cordifolia powder, Terminalia chebula
  • Beverage it in the morning on an unfilled stomach.


Cranberry Juice




Cranberries are a rich source of organic acids like malic acid, citric acid, and quinic acid that function as digestive enzymes. Besides cranberries are also known to clear toxins and fats deposits in your lymphatic system. Cranberry juice digests these lymphatic wastes and help you reduce fat.


  • Each morning have 100 percent cranberry juice (unsweetened).
  • Or have a cup of cran-water before or after meals. Mix 2 tbsp of cranberry juice with cup of water to make cran-water.


Bottle Gourd Juice


Bottle gourds are a extremely popular vegetable for losing belly fat. High in dietary fibre, vitamin C, riboflavin and others minerals, gourd help with weight loss, reduce bad cholesterol & fats, and  improve digestion. It is a great way to resist cravings as it creates a sensation of fullness and curbs appetite.


  • For a flat tummy, daily have a glass of bottle gourd juice for breakfast.
  • Mix 2 tbsp of lemon juice and a pinch of pepper and black salt.
  • Have a glass of cold bottle gourd juice whenever you feel the urge for snacks.


5. Consume Healthy Fats


Don’t be surprised! Our bodies need essential fatty-acids (EFAs) to properly synthesize the hormones responsible for metabolizing fat stores. Try some of these sources of healthy to help you burn belly fat faster:


Almonds




Almonds contain a good amount of healthy fats — polyunsaturated and monounsaturated. Both fats help prevent you from overeating. Rich in vitamins and minerals, like Vitamin E, iron, magnesium, and calcium, almonds are proven to suppress hunger.


Chocolate


Chocolate can help flatten your belly, especially dark chocolate. Dark chocolate contains the highest percentage of pure cocoa butter, a source of digestion-slowing saturated fat called stearic acid. Since it takes more time to process, dark chocolate staves off hunger and helps you lose weight.


Coconut Oil




Coconut oil contains medium chain triglycerides (MCTs), which are shorter and more water soluble than other fats. MCTs are easily digestible, quickly converted into energy by your liver rather than being stored as fat, and hence stimulate your body’s metabolism.



6. Develop Healthy Food Habits


Many people would suggest dieting if you ask them on how to reduce tummy fast by home remedies.

Ultimately your body weight is directly depended on how you consume food. But instead of dieting, you should make healthy food choices and commit to a balanced diet.


Don’t skip meals- When you starve your body, it gets into survival mode and starts storing foods in the form of fat. So, never ever skip your meals so as lose weight, as it will have negative effect on your health.


  • Have breakfast, lunch and dinner daily.
  • Snack on healthy foods in between these main meals.


Avoid sugary/salty substances- Sugar is one of the main culprits for gaining weight around your tummy. Salt in excess, leads to water retention around your abdominal area and makes you pot bellied. Stay away from sweets, carbonated drinks and processed foods as these can increase body fat around various areas of your body like abdomen and thighs.


Eat Slowly- Eating in a hurry leads to ingesting air and slowing down the digestion. Take time to eat and chew each morsel well. This will control the amount of food you intake and leave satisfied much earlier.


Don’t eat before bed- Avoid eating directly before sleep as your metabolism slams on the brakes making weight gain tough to avoid. Preferably have a light dinner. Also don’t go to sleep directly after dinner, instead go for a short walk.


Reduce Your Alcohol Intake- It’s better to avoid alcohol altogether but if you can’t at least reduce the quantity and frequency of alcohol intake.



7. Sneak in some exercise




Changing your food habits alone doesn’t help you with weight loss. Having regular physical exercises is a must to reduce the fat and make your tummy flat. It is important that exercises intended at cutting down on the amount of fat belly be targeted at the lower abdominal regions such as sit ups.


While not everyone has time to spend two hours at the gym every day, it is still possible to get enough daily activity to help your body burn off unwanted belly fat.


Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis (NEAT) activities


NEAT activities can help you burn calories while you are at work. These include: walking, standing, climbing the stairs etc when in office.


Cardiovascular Exercises


Walking, jogging, running, cycling, aerobics etc. increases your body’s capacity to burn more calories.


Running - Go for running at least 2-3 times a week to reduce your tummy fast.


Brisk walking - Go to a local park or walk around your neighborhood.


Swimming - If you have a local swimming pool nearby, this is a great way to lose belly fat fast.


Strength Training


Besides cardiovascular exercises, you should strength training of your muscles to have a lean body and tummy.


8. Massage your tummy


Perform stomach massage daily to help reduce abdominal fat and waist circumference. Massages are usually related with relieving muscle pains, so you may be wondering how will it reduce tummy fast? 


Abdominal massage has been used by many cultures since ancient times and has numerous health benefits. It aids in weight loss, not only through ridding the body of backed-up, compacted waste by eliminating constipation, but also through promoting proper metabolic and digestive function.


Benefits:

  • Reduction in bloating
  • Relief from constipation
  • Speeds up digestion
  • Increased abdominal muscle tone


How to perform abdominal massage


  1. Lie flat on your back on a firm surface i.e. bed or a mat.
  2. Lift up your shirt and expose your tummy.
  3. Rub your hands together vigorously until they feel hot.
  4. Place one hand flat on your belly button.
  5. Begin a firm rubbing motion around your belly button, gradually widening the circles using a firm pressure. Each circle should take 1-2 seconds.
  6. Focus your mind on the heat building up in your abdominal region as you rub.
  7. Perform this exercise for two minutes, about 40-50 circles. That’s it you have performed your first stomach massage.


9. Make your Tummy Flat with Tea


Green Tea




Green tea has long been known to help in weight reduction. Consuming green tea daily can make your tummy flat. A research published in American journal of nutrition said people who consumed 4 cups of green tea indicated a fat loss of up to six pounds over a period of two months. It contains a component known as EGCG which is known to boost metabolism and thus burn fat faster.


  • Add a few leaves of green tea or tea bag to hot water.
  • Boil it for five to ten minutes.
  • Strain the mixture and add honey for taste.


Dandelion and Peppermint Tea


Dandelion and peppermint tea is a fabulous drink that will help keep your liver healthy and thus reduce your tummy fast. A natural diuretic, dandelion increases your urine output and as such flush out retained water and toxins from your body.  Peppermint and dandelion also automatically stimulate the production of bile in the liver, helping with digestion and the absorption of nutrients.

  • Add 1 tsp of fresh/dried dandelion and 1 tsp fresh/dried peppermint leaves to cup of water.
  • Add lemon to taste if you like, and drink a cup twice daily.


10. Relax & Sleep Well




A surprising way to lose your body fat without exercise is by catching more sleep. A average person needs six to eight hours per night. This will help keep your insulin levels and your stress hormones in check. Plus, you have the necessary energy to burn calories more effectively during the day.


Turn off all your gadgets - When in bed, shut down all your electronics especially smartphones. Researchers have found that short-wavelength blue light, which is emitted tablets and smartphones, disrupts the body’s production of melatonin and, as a result, could your sleep cycle.


Relax - Also make sure to keep your mind relaxed. A stressful mind can have impact on hormones such as adrenaline, corticotropin and cortisol, that can increase your appetite and make you overeat. So whenever stress plagues your mind go for a walk. Listening to music is another stress reliever. Try mediation for easing off the stress.

c_title: The Best Running Tips - 101
c_mobile_body:
Whether you are a beginner, a marathon runner or a veteran, we have got you covered. This is a short and crisp list of running techniques which are simple and effective at the same time.



1) Ready - Set - Go



Just know the fact that everyone is an athlete. The difference is that only some of us are training.



2) Simply aim for this

 

Let’s stop hiding behind the reason that we are busy. Just aim for running 10 to 14 miles per week. Studies suggest that doing so will have great health benefits.


 

3) Count minutes, not miles


 

Psychology suggests that for new runners it is better to increase the minutes of your running time rather than miles. This is a better way to increase your running distance.


 

4) Follow what your body has to say



 

If you feel hungry then eat. Your body knows what it wants.



5) Have a good pair of running shoes


 

So finally when you have decided to include running in your schedule, investing in a pair of good running shoes will be a good decision.



6) Make sure your running shoes are slightly bigger

 

It is recommended that the pair of running shoes you wear to be slightly bigger than your foot size. This will avoid foot and toe pain.


7) Keep your body in a relaxed position while running


 

Keep your arms and shoulders relaxed when you are running. The running gets easy this way. People generally keep their shoulders stiff while running which makes the run a bit difficult.



8) Don’t think too much, just get it done


 

Bruce Lee quotes – “If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you will never get it done”. It’s okay even if you have a busy schedule just make sure to have a run even if it is for 10 minutes.


9) Follow the road rules


 

Avoid running in traffic as often as possible. Even if you have to run then a better choice would be to run against the traffic rather than alongside the traffic. Safety comes first before anything.


 

10) Avoid clenching fists while running


 

Run with cupped hands rather than clenched fists. For this you can pretend as if you were saving a lemon from falling off your hands.



11) Try running during noon-time


 

Running during the day time offers multiple benefits. Keeps you away from eating heavy lunch, you sweat more during the day time and of course gives you a short break from work.



12) Warm up


 

Try to warm up before you start your run like stretching your muscles or a light jogging.



13) Stay Hydrated


 

Bruce Lee quotes – “Be water, my friend”. I would say “Drink water, my friend”. Water flushes out the toxins from your body and makes you feel fresh all the time.



14) Good eating habits

 

It’s a good advice to indulge in good eating habits while working out.



15) Listen to your body


 

Do not run through pain. If your body does not allow or your legs feel painful then avoid it.



16) Follow the Nike motto: Just Do It.


 

This point is self explanatory. Don’t miss out on your running schedule. Just do it every day.


 

17) Make it playful.

 

Don’t do it because you have to do it, instead do it because it is fun.


 

18) The hidden treasure

 

All the warm ups that you do before running burn approximately 100 calories. It doesn’t sound much but it really adds up in the long run.


 

19) Don’t repeat mistakes

 

The optimum level of exercising is different for different individuals. If you feel pain then avoid running the next day.


 

20) Try different running styles


 

To make it playful, try to run with different running styles every day like jogging on Mondays, sprinting on Tuesdays, pace running on Wednesday and so on.


 

21) Avoid fats


 

Excessive intake of everything is bad. Just don’t consume fats in large quantities as fats slow down the process of digestion.


 

22) Make goals

 

Making running goals before leaving you house is a good way to stay motivated. These can be like: running 2 miles and jogging 1 mile and so on.


 

23) Plan it accordingly


 

Psychology says that we do things in a better way when we write them down somewhere. This principle can be applied here as well. Track your run and match it with the limit specified by you.


 

24) Be consistent

 

Running at a slow pace and consistently is better than sprinting fast and then sweating to finish.


 

25) Mix and match things

 

Add variety to your run. It can be like running for a minute and then jogging for 2 minutes and then sprinting for 1 minute.


 

26) Focus on the bigger picture


 

Rather than focusing on the style of your run, focus on the gain which is endurance.


 

27) Throw away the clutter

 

There is loads of information on the internet: run this time, run that way, run like this and blah-blah-blah. Just run how you want to.


 

28) Let the beats on

 

Our feet try to match up with the music being played. So just turn on the playlist that you like and get your kicks running.


 

29) Just keep going


 

It’s okay if you had a bad day and could not complete the target set by you, but remember “Every day is a new day”. So make sure to get it done the next day.


 

30) Run quality

 

There’s no hard and fast rule to running. But make sure to run quality miles. For instance, if you run 35 miles a week then about 8 of those should be quality. It will also boost your body’s aerobic capacity.


 

31) Keep the boredom at bay

 

Doing same things everyday can turn out to be a bit boring. So you can jazz up your running time, style and routine a little.


 

32) Try cross eating


 

Cross eating simply means adding variety to your diet. A good approach to this is to add a new food every Sunday. This approach really expands your nutritional range.


 

33) Relax a bit after running


 

After your run is complete just take a few moments to relax, calm down and stretch. Avoid rushing back to the busy life after that.


 

34) Take it easy

 

Aggressive stretching after running may lead to increased injury risk. So just take it calmly.


 

35) Think big, start small

 

Just keep in mind the big picture but act on weekly basis to achieve that. For example plan the running schedule for the next 12 days but have in mind how will things change after a span of 3 months. I think that’s a great way to stay motivated.


 

36) Don’t just hit the rock bottom

 

The thing that differentiates good runners to average runners is persistence. Anyone can train themselves into the ground but greatness lies in doing something that makes you stronger every passing day.


 

37) Be in the moment


 

Don’t forget to smell the flowers and hear the birds chirruping during your morning run. This will really make your morning run awesome.


 

38) Go with an open mind

 

Whenever you approach a new workout or running technique just go on with it like a beginner.


 

39) Try Fartlek Runs

 

Fartlek runs basically mean “speed play”. Just play around with different speed and styles during your run.


 

40) Act smart

 

Place the energy drinks or container bottles filled with water on your running track. This trick is useful when you are aiming for a long run.


 

41) Work on intensity

 

It’s said that a long run puts a “beast” in a “person”.


 

42) Don’t keep an eye on the watch


 

The best way to do it is to avoid wearing a watch when you go running. It is sometimes better not to compare time from day to day.


 

43) Take rest

 

Suppose you work out for 5 days, then make sure to take rest for next 2 days. This will keep your body injury free.



44) Pick and roll

 

Just pick on one thing every month that you need to work on and then act. It is quite difficult to work on everything all at once.


 

45) Try the resistance running


 

By this we mean “run to the hills”. Hill running will also make your leg muscles stronger.


 

46) Include workouts with your run

 

Adding chest and legs workout along with your run is a great way to boost endurance.


 

47) Adapt

 

Running up the hills puts force on your leg and thigh muscles and in turn makes you stronger. Your muscles learn to adapt to new and increasing stress.


48) Avoid running downside

 

There is no added advantage to running down the hills. Half of the work gets done on its own and it exerts very less force on the legs.


49) Invest in a treadmill if hills are far off


 

These days treadmills come with a incline up technology where you can increase the inclined-running angle. This is a good alternative to upside hill running.



50) Try the tempo runs

 

Tempo runs range for a shorter distance but they are generally at higher pace than the normal. They are the key to improving speed and stamina.


 

51) Imagination makes things easy

 

If you are having difficulty running up the hill then imaging then a rope is tied to your waste which is pulling you upwards.


 

52) Save energy for the top

 

It’s better to start running from somewhere in between the hill road so that you can complete till the summit.


 

53) Eat Healthy

 

The food that you feed to your body acts as the fuel for further mechanisms. A diet with balanced amount of proteins, carbohydrates and other nutrients will keep your body in great shape all the time.


 

54) Switch between running and jogging

 

Switching between running and jogging will improve your body’s stamina and will give you a variety run.


55) Keep increasing everyday

 

Just make sure to increase your running speed every day. This will help you build endurance. If that seems difficult you can also increase your running time.


 

56) Quality matters

 

If you stay in your comfort zone and never do the exercises or runs which seem difficult then it is not going to get great things done for you. Instead challenge yourself and it will be fun.


 

57) Stay informed

 

Stay informed about the weather conditions, the run tracks and most important your fitness levels.


 

58) Flexibility adds to the core

 

If your body is flexible then it really matters. It will reduce the chances of injury and help you run better.


 

59) Get over with it

 

If you had a bad run or a bad workout day then simply sweat it out for 30 minutes and get going.


 

60) Pass by the other runners

 

Passing by the other runners while completing your run is studied to give you an adrenaline rush and help you stay motivated.


 

61) Stay Patient

 

You have to wait for 7-8 successful track runs to see the results. So be patient for that time period.


 

62) Check your pulse

 

Just check the pulse rate. If it is above 10 than average then you need to rest as you have not recovered from the earlier day’s session training.


 

63) Run long

 

The idea behind is simple: “Run further”. Just keep on increasing your running distance by 0.3 miles every day. This is not much, but it really adds up in the long run.


 

64) Tie it properly

 

It is annoying to stop in the middle of the race to tie your shoe lace. So just double tie them before you start your run.


 

65) Observe

 

Once you get hold of the warmup and stretching routine that works best for you then follow it. Try repeating it as a daily ritual.


 

66) Wearing the perfect pairs

 

Studies say that wearing shoes that are feather-lite help you to run further. So light weight shoes are better when it comes to running long distances.


 

67) Finish fast


 

Whether you start your run with a slow jog or a fat paced jog, complete your run at a speed faster than at which you initiated.



68) Persistence matters

 

It is okay to start at a pace which is slow than to run too fast and then starving to oxygen debt. Just be consistent at the running pace.


 

69) Don’t miss out

 

If everything is perfect and your body allows too then do not miss out on the routine of running. If you do then have a backup plan to cover it up.


 

70) Interval Training

 

Sprint for 30 seconds and then slow down to a speed approximately 75% of your sprint pace and then continuing at that speed for another 3-4 minutes.


 

71) Go Minimal

 

Run for about 25minutes three times in a week and then increase the third week run’s length.


 

72) Build it gradually

 

Rather than slow jogging today and immediately sprinting tomorrow, it is better to build upon speed in a gradual way.


 

73) Do not push it too further

 

It is said that 2.5 hours slow run is better than 2 hours of sprinting.


 

74) Do progressive runs

 

The principle behind is simple: Start at a slow pace – Constantly increase your pace – Finish sprinting.


 

75) Keep an eye for this

 

Whenever you are in the “hard training session” feel free to keep a day off for rest. The other thing to watch out or is to never run for more than 3 hours straight.


 

76) Feather-bed you muscles


 

If you are going under a hard training then soak in a hot bath sometimes and get your muscles massaged on a weekly basis. Of course it is your body, you can pamper it.



77) Go for diet that is iron rich

 

Iron and Vitamin C are a good way to keep anaemia at bay. Iron will also give you good amount of energy needed for training.


 

78) Include weights

 

You can wear ankle weights while running. This makes it easy for you to run when you run without them, so in a way you train in a hard way.


 

79) Go Plyometrics

 

Plyometrics are the explosive workouts like Froggy jumps, jumping squats and so on. They are the core to building muscular body.


 

80) Divide into groups of three

 

Divide your run into threes: Running the first one with your head, the second with your personality, and the last with your heart – Mike Fanelli.


 

81) Don’t rush

 

Just because you have practiced so much on your running style you will have an edge over the other runners. So take it easy and show it when the right time comes.


 

82) Walk before you run


It is like a phrase being used – “go easy and then go hard”. This way you will not feel out of breath and will have developed a good stamina in the long run.


 

83) Being a copycat helps sometimes

 

If you visualise how your run is going to be then the whole process of running becomes easy. If you role model someone who is calm and composed then it will have a good impact on your run too.


 

84) Stay positive

 

If you have a calm attitude towards your running psych then it will surely help you. From the words of Buddha – “What you think is what you become” is what I am trying to talk in here. So keeping a positive attitude will reflect in your workout as well.


 

85) Comfort investing

 

Investing in clothes and footwear that feel comfortable is always a win-win.


 

86) Avoid alcohol


 

Avoid taking alcohol if possible or else you can indulge in taking moderate amounts of alcohol. The munchies that we tend to consume when having alcohol is also one of the prominent factors of weight increase.


 

87) Be a smart trainer

 

By smart training I mean making a proper schedule of time, days and the rest days based on your training. Working out based on schedule also gives you a sense of completion.


 

88) Make use of technology


 

These days the mobile phone application stores are filled with a ton of fitness apps. You can probably use one of them which sets your running schedule. The one which I know of and is great is Nike+ training application.


 

89) Have a cup of coffee


 

This is one of the common advices that we get – to have a cup of coffee before starting your physical workout. Just make sure to consume it in moderate amounts.


 

90) Try socialising


 

Another way to stay motivated is to run with a group of people. Try searching for a running group that is nearby the area you live or else you can find them on the internet.



91) Try meditating



Mediation is known to have a positive effect on our body. It improves your respiratory system and also helps in proper functioning of the body.



92) Try Yoga


 

Studies show that Yoga increases muscle tone and strength. Improves respiration, muscular flexibility and also makes you feel fresh.



93) Heavy weight lifting


 

Try explosive workouts which include heavy weights. Workouts like these strengthen the core. A strong core is surely going to help you in running tirelessly.



94) Calf workout

 

It is said that stronger calf muscles lead to increased vertical jump by a factor of 10 inches. So it gets easy for you to hop around easily while running.


96) Proper sleep


 

Follow anything, but if you miss this one out then everything goes down the drain. 8 hours of sleep is required by the human for its proper functioning. So do not miss out on your sleep.



97) Avoid energy boosters

 

Try avoiding energy drinks. Energy drinks don’t provide you with real energy but are loaded with heavy doses of caffeine. So avoid them as much as possible.


 

98) Squats


 

Well, squats improve your thigh muscle strength and strong thighs are the core reason to good running.


 

99) One goal a day

 

It is like an apple a day keeps the doctor away. Similarly a run a day lays the foundation forward. Try setting up daily run goals rather than setting up for a whole month and try to complete them.


 

100) Train with somebody


 

Having a training partner is better than going solo always. This way you both keep a check on each other’s goal and it keeps you motivated.


 

101) Just run

 

Last but not the least – Just run consistently. If you keep doing that every day you will realise that in no time you would have become a better runner.

Happy running

c_title: Best Running Tips to Boost Weight Loss
c_mobile_body:
Are you looking forward to lose weight? Luckily, there are so many methods and tricks to go about it and running being one of them.


But the important question is: What exactly is the best way to go about reaching an optimal weight loss? So we did some soul searching over the internet and met a few running experts to gain accurate knowledge over the subject.


To keep things simple and informational we have put together a list of all the running tips and tricks to boost your weight loss process. And here we go!


1) Run regularly


It is advised that you should start out running sessions at least three times a week and then gradually increase the practice to four or five times a week.


Generally, the more you are able to work out, the better will be the results, but it is really important to make sure that you care and listen to your body. If the body signals that you need a break, then you should just take it. If you don’t listen to your body, this will lead to serious injuries.



2) Bring strength training into main focus 


It’s unfortunate that it is really hard to reach your weight loss goals with running sessions alone. Studies tell that higher the amount of muscles in your body, higher your basal metabolic rate will be.


Hence, in addition to your running training you should also try to include at least one or two strength training workouts per week either with your own body weight or you can also use free weights. There are also wide apps available that will help you to maximize strength training practice with running.



3) Mix up your training sessions


At first, any beginner can achieve good results with short and easy runs. However, with time your body will quickly adapt to this training stimulus and build up reserves. This presents a big problem for more experienced runners; over the time period the fat burning gains will grow more and more small.



In order to avoid this situation, you need to incorporate as much variety as you can in your workout sessions. “Don’t give your body the chance to get used to your flow of workouts,” said Sascha, a well known running coach in America. By switching your training, you force your body to adaptation. This, in turn, will help you to improve your performance and boosts your metabolism.




Make variety a part of your routine and in addition to the long-distances runs, work in some intervals, sprints, technique drilling and strength training. A good rule of thumb often advised is never to do the same workout twice back to back.


 

4) Gradually increase your intensity


 

“An engine that is running at full speed burns a lot of fuel!” This is a very good way to picture the fat burning mechanism of your body during the intense running session. A strenuous interval workout session requires a lot of energy.


While at the same time it is true that the amount of fat burned in the metabolic process is quite high during the slow runs, but the total daily energy expenditure, and hence the number of calories burned, is comparatively low due to the low intensity of the session.


On the other hand, in case of high intensity workouts, like intervals, the amount of fat burned in the metabolic process is significantly lower, but at the same time the total daily energy expenditure and the calories burned are many folds higher. Furthermore, the “after burn” effect is much higher during the recovery period from a higher intensity workout than a lower one. For all these reasons, you shouldn’t do more than one in a week.


 

5) Don’t forget to give yourself timely breaks


 

Your body needs some time in order to adapt to all the different training stimuli. Thus, give yourself at least one or two day rest per week. Also, make sure that you get sufficient sleep. This influences all kinds of metabolic processes in your body. Also, take walks in between your running because it not only helps your muscles to cool down but also increases your endurance and stamina in the long run.


“Walking helps in reducing the impact force on the muscles, tendons and joints and also reduces the breathing rate and heart rate,” says running coach John Hadfield, co author of Marathoning for mortals and the founder at coach-john.com. Taking walk breaks also helps in lowering the impact on the body, which may prevent cramping and soaring of the muscles. During your weekend running session, so a brisk walk for 30 to 60 seconds after every 2 kilometre, no matter the total distance, says John.

 

 

6) Don’t just cut too many calories



When it comes down to weight loss, runners should think of calories in terms of energy. If you don’t take in sufficient amount of calories, you won’t get the required amount of energy to fuel your workout properly. This means that you will probably end up burning fewer calories.


“If you are eating right amount for your sport, you will be able to lose the excess weight in a healthy way without experiencing fatigue and poor workouts”. It is not at all about the deprivation. If you are really eating for energy, the weight will surely come out.

  

 

7) Time your meals

 

It’s very important for athletes to properly schedule their diet in order to best fuel the muscles. If your workouts are in the morning time, your dinner surely shouldn’t be your biggest food meal.


Make sure that you are getting sufficient amount of carbohydrates before your workout and a have good enough recovery snacks that contains carbohydrates and a little bit of protein, like fat-free chocolate powdered milk or, in case if you are a vegan, then you can use soya milk or may be almond milk, a banana and a small scoop of plant based protein with some ice inside the blender.


 

8) Plan ahead



When you are planning out your meals for the week, you are more likely to stay on the track of healthy eating routine. Planning and then sticking to a routine is really helpful in removing most of the chatter involved in making food decisions.


It also eliminates the risk of eating impulsive foods out of craving that almost in all circumstances affect blood sugar levels and makes us the only victim of food craving and grazing.


 

9) Hit the hills



If you are used to doing running on the flat ground, then hitting the hills will definitely help you burn more calories. For each and every degree of incline, you get about a 10-20 percent increase in total calories burnt, so a mild hill running session will likely burn about 60 percent more fat. Run up the hill at a high speed for 10-30 seconds, then jog back down and take a 40-60 second rest.


Repeat this training 4-10 times or as your body allows. If you are in the gym, then set the treadmill to a 10-12 percent incline for the run. Not only is this going to be really helpful in burning more calories. Running on the hills is also likely to shape and tone your body.


 

10) Step it up

 

So now you have hit the hills, but now you are eyeing for some new challenge? Perhaps it is time to take it to the stairs. Stair running has been known as one of the best and most effectively proven method for fast calories burning and the overall conditioning exercise you can do.


It’s indeed pretty simple as well: run up the stairs and then do a mild-jog/ trot back down to recover. Obviously you need to be very careful while doing this exercise. If you were thinking that hill run was tough, then this exercise will kick your butt.



11) Nutrition, recovery and after burn effect


If you are really interested in burning fat during running sessions, you need to make sure that your body should burn more calories per day than it intakes. Running experts often explain that “it highly depends on a good ratio of exercise and a healthy diet.”


If you only focus on only one of the factors, it is definitely going to be quite hard to achieve or sustain your balanced weight.


Sportsperson often consume a lot of carbohydrates to build up glycogen stores in their muscles. “Generally speaking, this is vital for your body’s ability to perform physical exercise.” But, the consumption of carbohydrates can also interfere with the metabolism mechanism of fats.


Consequently, if you want to decrease your fat stores, you shouldn’t drink or eat anything that contains sugar post your workout. Your body must learn to recover after your workout.


This is known as the”after burn” effect. This effect is especially seen highest after interval training or intensive strength training.


Bottom line from experts: “The best way and most tested way to lose weight is a combination of running, intense strength training and balanced nutrition.” So get out there and test the running expert’s tips to enhance your weight loss!

Poor people, specially, could not afford costly medicines and treatments. Thus, they used to brew garlic as tea or eat them raw to prevent any kind of diseases and infections. Even the rich people, in ancient times, used to mix garlic in their wine and drink it as a medicinal tonic to improve their strength and immunity system.

Is Garlic Good for Your Heart?

Well, to answer that question, researchers from the University of Alabama (Birmingham) and the University Of Connecticut School Of Medicine have conducted studies, and they have come up with surprisingly positive results. Let’s see what researchers in each of these institutions have to say:

 

The University of Alabama (Birmingham)

According to the research led by Dr. David Kraus at this University, allicin (in garlic) plays the pivotal role in keeping the heart healthy. Allicin breaks down into sulfur compounds (responsible for tainting the breath), which react with the body’s red blood cells to create hydrogen sulfide.


This hydrogen sulfide ensures easy flow of blood and relaxation of the blood vessels. The Alabama team, for this research, bathed the blood vessels of rats in a bath that contained juice extracted from garlic (crushed). Read: Garlic is a Natural Blood Thinner and Helps in Preventing Blood Clots


The results were astonishing, as the tension in the vessels lowered by as much as 72%. It was also found in the study that when the red blood cells were exposed to the garlic juice, they began emitting the foul-smelling hydrogen sulfide almost immediately.


Dr. Kraus concluded from this study that consuming garlic as part of one’s diet can be very good for the heart. Areas like the Far East and the Mediterranean, where garlic consumption is high, record very few cases of cardiovascular diseases.

 

The University Of Connecticut School Of Medicine

Researchers at the Cardiovascular Research Center of this University have found out that garlic that is freshly crushed proves to be more useful in keeping the heart protected when compared to cooked or dried garlic. Read: Proven Benefits of Eating Raw Garlic on Empty Stomach


Professor Dipak K. Das (PhD, ScD) of the Cardiovascular Research Center and coauthor of this study, opines that garlic that is crushed freshly generates the foul-smelling hydrogen sulfide gas. This gas might prove hazardous in large quantity, but in small quantity hydrogen sulfide works as intracellular signaling compound, which keeps the heart protected.


He further says that due to the fact that hydrogen sulfide is short-lived, the gas disappears every time garlic is cooked, dried or processed. Processed or dried garlic does contain antioxidant effects, but it is not as high as in case of fresh garlic.


For this study, the researchers provided dried and fresh garlic (crushed) to two different lab rat groups, and closely studied the recovery of the animals from heart attacks (simulated). They came to the conclusion that processed as well as fresh garlic lowers the damage from the lack of oxygen; however, the rats who were provided with fresh garlic were able to restore a good amount of blood flow in their aorta as against those provided with processed garlic.

Garlic Benefits For Heart

  • Reduces triglycerides and blood pressure
  • Lowers the formation of artery plaque
  • Reduces LDL particles and oxidation, which plays a huge role in damaging lipid and putting heart at risk
  • Discourages platelet aggregation


So, is garlic good for your heart? Yes! It is not only good but a highly palatable and more accessible medicine. Make sure to include garlic in your daily diet if you want to keep your heart healthy and protected.

c_title: Improve Cardiovascular Health with Turmeric
c_mobile_body:
Turmeric is a spice that is widely used in the Indian cuisine as it has a very particular flavor, which makes the Indian curries extra special. This ingredient has excellent health benefits. It is not only an excellent natural antibiotic but is also very helpful in the treatment of infections. It also helps to prevent Alzheimer's and is very beneficial for the cardiovascular health of human beings.



The benefits of this precious ingredient for cardiovascular health are mainly due to its high content of curcumin, which is not only beneficial for cardiovascular health but has also recently been shown to help prevent cancer and diabetes among other diseases. Studies have shown that the consumption of turmeric for cardiovascular health is as beneficial as doing aerobic exercise on a daily basis.



Also Read: Amazing Nutritional Value of Turmeric: Offers a Wealth of Nutrients to Boost Your Health


The Study



Studies conducted on turmeric have demonstrated that its regular consumption can be as effective for the health of the heart as one hour of aerobic exercise. It is particularly remarkable in menopausal women, who at that age, usually have a precarious heart.



This study was based mainly on three groups of women who were under observation for eight weeks. The groups were divided into:



  1. The first group consisted of women who were not on any treatment.
  2. The second group of women was responsible for performing physical aerobic activities to improve their cardiovascular health such as bicycling and walking.
  3. The third group of women was treated with turmeric.



Women in the turmeric group consumed 150 mg of turmeric extract daily for eight weeks, which resulted in the intake of 25 mg of curcumin. In addition to that, their eating and physical activity habits were maintained and examined during the study.



During the weeks of observation, it was noted that the group that performed physical activities and the one that consumed turmeric showed an improvement in the endothelial cells after two months of treatment.



With this study, the researchers could conclude that the intake of turmeric or performing aerobic activity significantly improves endothelial function to the same extent in a human body. Likewise, the consumption of turmeric in postmenopausal women can prevent the deterioration of cardiovascular health by the passage of years.


Also Read: Turmeric Benefits Weight Loss, keeps Weight Gain at Bay


Why Drinking a Glass of Turmeric Can Be Better Than Doing 60 Minutes of Exercise?



The health benefits of turmeric can be attributed to its primary active compound curcumin. Not only is it responsible for the yellow color of the spice, but it also has properties that can help boost the cardiovascular function, especially in postmenopausal women. Therefore, it is highly recommended that you consume one teaspoon of turmeric a day without default. You can add it to your smoothies, sprinkle it on your dishes or even drink it in a tea. As an alternative, you can also buy turmeric extract capsules and ingest them daily.



Let’s find out the different ways to consume turmeric for the excellent health of your heart!



How to Consume Turmeric?



  • It is important to note that in this study, the participants were given a portion of curcumin greater than what is usually contained in turmeric. So, to obtain the same results, you should ideally eat a teaspoon of turmeric powder daily.
  • If you want, you can also consume turmeric capsules that you can find online or in any health food store. If you prefer to use turmeric powder, you can also take it in tea or in the so-called milk of gold, which is merely the combination of turmeric with the milk of your preference.
  • You can also ingest it simply by adding it in your meals as an ingredient, which enhances the taste of the dishes with its delicious and particular flavor.

Bottom Line

But in recent years, turmeric has been gaining the attention of scientists, thanks to the discovery of its healing abilities. Turmeric is considered a superfood and it is a valued ingredient in Ayurvedic medicine. We have spoken on numerous occasions of turmeric, highlighting its impressive anti-inflammatory and antibiotic properties. This spice is usually included in all superfood lists as it also helps fight certain types of cancer and improve memory.



Therefore, consume this wonder spice daily to have a healthy heart!

c_title: Turmeric Benefits Weight Loss, keeps Weight Gain at Bay
c_mobile_body:
While scientists and doctors around the world investigate substances of natural origin such as spices, vegetables, and herbs and discover their fat burning properties, turmeric has already been endorsed by many of them. Would you like to know how turmeric can help you in your mission to lose weight? Then keep reading!



How Turmeric Causes Weight Loss

Many theories explain how turmeric helps you lose weight. There are two ways in which people become "fat" or have an increase in weight. One is the excessive growth of the size of the fat cells. The other is an excess of multiplication of fat cells, i.e., the number of cells that occur. If any of these processes can slow down, weight loss would be possible.



Turmeric contains curcumin, which inhibits cell division in adipocytes (fat cells) by reducing the amount of blood that flows in these cells. Due to the lack of incoming fresh blood nutrients, the fat cells do not increase in number.


Also Read: Turmeric is a Natural Beauty Booster, having Amazing Benefits for Skin


The Diet of Turmeric to Lose Weight

As with all fashions, when there is any indication of a substance that shows promise in weight loss solutions, different diets and regimens arise incorporating turmeric. One of them is the turmeric diet that essentially involves eating it directly. There are two ways to do it:



1. Spices and Supplements:

Turmeric is a well-known spice and is used in India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Morocco, etc. Therefore, it is not difficult to incorporate it into your regular diet. You just have to add a little turmeric powder to your spice mix and observe its bright orange color. You can also drink an infusion like tea. If all else fails, you can buy turmeric supplements at the pharmacy.



2. Drinks:

You can even make a smoothie with vegetables such as cabbage, kale and cinnamon and simply put a handful of turmeric. In India, turmeric in milk is given to children to boost their development and immunity.



Also Read: Amazing Nutritional Value of Turmeric: Offers a Wealth of Nutrients to Boost Your Health


3. Soups

You can prepare a delicious soup with carrot and turmeric, which in addition to being delicious and contributing to your goal of losing weight, is excellent for people suffering from chronic inflammation, fibromyalgia, arthritis and other inflammatory diseases.



Turmeric is considered miraculous for health. Let’s check out some other benefits of turmeric!



Turmeric A "Miraculous" Spice

Turmeric is used in the kitchens of the Indian subcontinent and several other parts of the world for its earthy flavor and bright color. It has several health benefits, and weight loss is one of them. It has the following health benefits:


  • It is anti-inflammatory by nature. As a result, it helps those who have painful joints and related conditions such as arthritis. Also, unlike anti-inflammatory drugs, turmeric has no side effects.
  • It has antiseptic and antimicrobial properties. Therefore, if you have an injury, turmeric can accelerate the healing process.

  • Turmeric gives your immune system a healthy stimulus. It even protects and fights against certain types of cancer such as breast cancer and melanoma.
  • It has been used as an antidepressant in China for centuries.
  • It also helps in the elimination of accumulated toxins in the liver.



Turmeric Reduces Cholesterol

Studies have linked turmeric directly with reducing blood cholesterol. The curcumin present in turmeric affects low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (also known as "bad cholesterol").



In a scientific study conducted on rabbits, it was observed that not only does the regular consumption of turmeric reduces LDL cholesterol and triglycerides in the blood, but also prevents getting oxidized LDL. Oxidized LDL is responsible for atherosclerosis - a condition in which the blood vessels in and around the heart contract due to the deposit of cholesterol in the walls of the heart.


Also Read: Improve Cardiovascular Health with Turmeric


However, these experiments and studies have only been done on rats and rabbits, but not in humans. What works in one mammal may not be as effective in another mammal. But, even if we assume that the success rate is the same in humans as in rats and rabbits, it is not a complete cure. Anywhere between half and a third of the animals in the study frame showed significant results. Thus, there is no way to determine what dose of turmeric per day would produce beneficial effects in humans.



So, are you ready to improve your overall health and lose weight by consuming turmeric?

c_mobile_body:
Bronchial Asthma is caused by excess Kapha dosha in human body.



Ayurveda focuses on moving khapa accumulated in the lungs and bronchi to the stomach and then removing it from there.



Allergy – which triggers asthma and wheezing is an indication of internal disharmony and unhealthy lifestyle.



Khapa reducing diet that helps with asthma:

  • Fast - for 3 to 9 days on lime juice and honey for first half of your fasting period and then move to a fruit juice diet to nourish the body and eliminate toxins.
  • Intermittent Fasting - Done for a day every week or every fortnight. It helps to detoxify the body and increases resistance against infections and diseases.
  • Include Alkaline Foods – Like fresh fruits, green vegetables, germinated gram, etc.
  • Avoid Acidic Foods – Like rice, sugar, curd, fried foods, etc.



Remedy for Immediate Relief from Wheezing



Licorice Tea



Image: Licorice Roots


Get immediate relief from wheezing and asthma with this tea - as explained by Dr. Vasant Lad in his book - The Complete Book of Ayurvedic Home Remedies:


Boil 1 teaspoon of licorice root (yasti madhu) in a cup of water for a couple of minutes to make a licorice tea. Just before drinking the tea, add 5 to 10 drops od mahanarayan oil if you have some, or use ½ teaspoon of plain ghee. Take one sip of this tea every 5 to 10 minutes.


In some instances, the licorice tea may induce vomiting. This is beneficial: It eliminates khapa and relives the spasm of the bronchial tubes, and the person usually feels better immediately.


You can use this licorice tea not only for emergencies but, if you are prone to develop asthma, every day as a preventive. The only exception is that individuals with hypertension should not use much licorice tea, as it makes the body retain sodium. They may take it as an emergency measure to avert an asthma attack, but they should not drink it regularly.


Note: Prepare the tea as soon as you begin to feel an attack coming on, when there is tightness in the chest, some difficulty breathing, or whatever warning bell symptoms you recognize from past experiences. Don’t wait until you are already having serious problems breathing.


Once you prepare the tea, it can last for 72 hours and not lose its effectiveness.



Steam Inhalation


Inhaling warm and moist air can help clearing the bronchial track and provide relief from wheezing.

Add peppermint to the water while taking steam to relax the bronchial muscles and reduce inflammation. (R)

  • Garlic must be cooked or heated to help with asthma.
  • Boil 300 to 400 ml of milk with finely chopped garlic and drink twice a day to prevent and cure asthma.
  • Garlic and Ginger tea also relieves wheezing and helps with bronchial asthma
  • It has anti-inflamatory, anti-allergen and antioxidant properties that helps with asthma. (R)
  • Garlic is an amazing herb that has been traditionally used by Egyptians Romans and medieval Arabs to treat asthma.





Turmeric

Turmeric when taken with a glass of milk 2 to 3 times a days helps with bronchial asthma. For maximum benefits take it on empty stomach.




Honey

Honey helps is thinning out mucus and clearing the respiratory passages. It inhibits the formation of mucus and reduces airway inflammation. (R﻿)
